newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends firmer as foreign funds flow in.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends firmer as foreign funds flow in.

text.p: Inflows of foreign equity funds pushed the Taiwan dollar to a higher finish against its American counterpart on Tuesday, dealers said.
The local dollar closed at T$27.438, off an intra-session high of T$27.425, against Monday's T$27.442 finish.
Turnover through dealers was an active US$302.5 million.
But slowing liquidity demand for the Taiwan dollar in the run-up to Friday's Chinese lunar new year holidays limited the local unit's gains, dealers said.

"Exporters' U.S. dollar sales wre not as active today as in previous sessions. Instead, importers have started to enter the market to buy the U.S. dollar at around the T$27.43 level," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
Dealers expected the Taiwan dollar gradually to depreciate when trading resumes after the new year holiday as pre-holiday demand for the local currency will have evaporated.
A range of T$27.43-45 was seen for Wednesday.
